title: Storm Center Update - Saturday PM
text:
Storm Center Update - Saturday PM October 10, 2015, 3:44 PM by Grant Smith 
It was a summer-like day in KELOLAND. Afternoon temperatures climbed into the 80s and some areas in central South Dakota reached the 90 degree mark. On top of the above average temperatures, skies were clear all day today. 
Overnight lows tonight will range in the low to middle 50s with clear skies. 
Tomorrow will be a repeat of today with the sunshine and clear skies and 80s for highs. However, cooler air will start to descend into the Midwest; bringing temperatures back down to the 60s and 70s for next week but the biggest change tomorrow will be the winds. Sunday afternoon, the sustained winds will speed up to the 20s and 30s with gusts in the 30s and 40s when the front passes. 
Next week is expected to be dry and sunny with highs in the 60s and 70s with lows in the 40s.
